But for all this, in a little time, Jonathan grew up to be very large of his age, and became a tall, stout, double-jointed, broad- footed cub of a fellow, awkward in his gait and simple in his appearance3 but showing a lively, shrewd look, and having the promise of great strength when he should get his full growth. He was rather an odd-looking chap, in truth, and had many queer ways5 but everybody that had seen John Bull saw a great likeness between them, and swore he was John’s own boy, and a true chip of the old block. Like the old squire, he was apt
